1:
ere are the extracted triplets:

<Hip Hip Pooh-Ray!
Winnie the Pooh and the Blustery Day
2:
--------------------
Text: Hip Hip Pooh-Ray!:  It is sung by the cast as a release from the dramatic tension of the story.
Triplets:<Hip Hip Pooh-Ray!
3:
--------------------
Text: Hip Hip Pooh-Ray!:  The song is also incorporated into (and used as the promotional tagline for) the 1977 musical film "The Many Adventures of Winnie the Pooh" which is an amalgamation of three Winnie-the-Pooh featurettes including "Blustery Day".
Triplets:<Winnie the Pooh
4:
--------------------
Text: Hip Hip Pooh-Ray!:  In the song, Pooh and Piglet are hailed as heroes (Pooh for saving Piglet's life, and Piglet for giving Owl his grand home in the beech tree).
Triplets:<In the song
